column2: ARIZONA DMV TEST
Question Text
1. What is the main reason night driving is more difficult than daytime driving?
column4: The use of headlight is required by law.

column2: 2. Right turn on red is permitted:
column4: only where indicated by a sign.
column8: except where prohibited by a sign.

column2: 3. Signs with this shape are _______ signs.
4. Large trucks:
column4: have high-tech air brakes which allow them to stop quickly.
column6: are more maneuverable than passenger vehicles.
column8: take longer to stop than passenger vehicles.

column2: 5. Which sign has white letters on a red background?
6. ___________ are green with white letters and symbols.
7. This road sign means:
8. What is the slow moving vehicle symbol?
9. What do warning signs mean?
column4: Drivers are approaching a location where there is a special rule.

column2: 10. Parking is not allowed:
column4: on the road side of a parked vehicle.

column2: 11. Where are yield signs usually placed?
column4: Where auxiliary roads lead into major roads.
column6: At intersections, if there is no marked stop line.
column8: Where major roads lead into  auxiliary roads.

column2: 12. On what three conditions does your blood alcohol content (BAC) depend?
column4: Your weight. How much alcohol you drink. How much time passes between drinks.
column6: Your weight. The type of beverage you drink. How fit you are.
column8: Your height. How much alcohol you drink. The type of beverage you drink.

column2: 13. What is the only effective method to reduce your BAC?
column6: Eating before or while you drink.
column8: Not drinking over a period of time.

column2: 14. A driver cuts off another vehicle, or threatens another motorist or a pedestrian. These are examples of:
15. Which statement about blind spots is true?
column4: Before changing lanes, you should check mirrors and look over your shoulder toward the rear.
column6: If traffic conditions permit you should cruise in blind spot of the vehicle ahead.
column8: Large trucks have smaller blind spots than most passenger vehicles.

column2: 16. When changing lanes:
column4: change lane before checking the inside rearview mirror.
column6: slow down and check your left mirror.
column8: look over your shoulder to make sure no one is in the blind spot.

column2: 17. Driving under the influence of any medication which impairs your driving ability is permitted:
column8: if it is prescribed by a physician.

column2: 18. What should you do if you see smoke come from under the hood?
column4: Try to fight the fire yourself.
column6: Call the fire department and then pull off the road and park your vehicle.
column8: Pull off the road and park your vehicle. Turn off the ignition, get away from the car and call the fire department.

column2: 19. Driver distractions include:
column6: Slowing down to look at crash scene.
column8: turning your headlights on when rain and fog make it hard to see.

column2: 20. Road signs that point out scenic areas and parks are:
21. If the entrance lane is too short to allow acceleration to expressway speed, you should:
column4: reduce your speed to 15 MPH or less and blend with traffic.
column6: stop and wait for a large space in traffic.
column8: enter the expressway and accelerate quickly.

column2: 22. Your car stalls on the tracks at a railroad crossing, and a collision with a train is imminent. After getting yourself and your passengers out of the car, you should:
column6: run toward the train but stay off the tracks.

column2: 23. At intersections, crosswalks, and railroad crossings, drivers should always:
column4: slowly pass vehicles the vehicles ahead.
column6: look to the sides of their vehicle to see what is coming.
column8: stop, listen for oncoming traffic, and proceed with caution.

column2: 24. When entering a road from an alley:
column6: you must stop before reaching the sidewalk.

column2: 25. This sign indicates:
column6: The road may be slippery when wet. Drive slowly.

column2: 26. To see vehicles in your blind spots, you must look:
27. What should drivers do when the red lights begin to flash?
28. If you hear a thumping sound while driving, you should:
column4: hook your shoe under the gas pedal and see if you can free it.
column8: get off the road and check your tires.

column2: 29. When a hazard is seen ahead, reaction distance:
column4: is the sum of perception distance and braking distance.
column6: equals total stopping distance minus perception distance.
column8: is how far a vehicle will continue to travel, in ideal conditions, before the driver hits the brakes.

column2: 30. What does it mean If an oncoming driver flashes headlights at you during a period of low visibility?
column4: Your vehicle was difficult to see. You should turn on your headlights.
column6: Your headlights are too bright. You should turn them off.
column8: Your headlights are too bright. You should use parking lights instead.
